block.p: Natasha Rebecca Sinel, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman M. Sinel of Washington, was married last evening to Andrew Michael Cohen, the son of Norene Green of Pittsford, N.Y., and Dr. David Cohen of Brighton, N.Y. Rabbi Arthur Blecher officiated at Halcyon House in Washington.

Mrs. Cohen, 29, is a manager of business development in the digital media group at Showtime Networks in New York. She graduated from Yale University and received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Michigan. Her father is a senior partner in Arnold & Porter, the Washington law firm. Her mother, Ellen Sinel, is a painter, also in Washington.

Natasha Rebecca Sinel, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Norman M. Sinel of Washington, was married last evening to Andrew Michael Cohen, the son of Norene Green of Pittsford, N.Y., and Dr. David Cohen of Brighton, N.Y. Rabbi Arthur Blecher officiated at Halcyon House in Washington.

Mrs. Cohen, 29, is a manager of business development in the digital media group at Showtime Networks in New York. She graduated from Yale University and received an M.B.A. degree from the University of Michigan. Her father is a senior partner in Arnold & Porter, the Washington law firm. Her mother, Ellen Sinel, is a painter, also in Washington.

Mr. Cohen, also 29, is a senior associate working on debt issues for Whitney & Company, the venture capital and investment concern in Stamford, Conn. He graduated from Cornell University. His mother is a preschool teacher at Public School 7 in Rochester. His father, a retired periodontist, practiced in Rochester.
